title: K-wave: How fans are supporting their favourite idols
description: From buying billboard space to food trucks, here's how fans of Korean pop culture support their idols.

title: 'War on Terror': Are big military deployments over?
description: Twenty years on from the "War on Terror", is it the end of big military deployments to warzones?

title: Shipping disruption: 'We're doing our best - but this is crippling'
description: Disruption in the shipping industry is creating a shortage of goods - and consumers face higher prices.

title: TV reunions: Why we're rarely 'on a break' from our favourite shows
description: High-profile TV reunions have never been more popular - but why now and what makes one successful?

title: Covid: Why has the Delta variant spread so quickly in UK?
description: It is now the dominant strain in the UK - but the rest of the world may well follow suit.

title: In pictures: 1,000 Dreams to mark World Refugee Day
description: Refugees across Europe set out to record the lives of those who have also fled persecution.

title: Return to the island where eagles watch you brush your teeth
description: Six months after Alex and Buffy moved to the Isle of Rum without visiting it, how has island life worked out?

title: 'Finally having a wig puts the smile on your face'
description: A girl, 15, who donated her hair to a cancer charity finds out a year later she has cancer herself.

title: 'World's oldest' alligator Muja celebrates 85th birthday at Belgrade Zoo
description: From surviving World War Two to becoming a hit on TikTok, Belgrade Zoo star Muja has been through a lot.

title: Euro 2020: Wales travel to Italy's Roman fortress for final group game
description: Wales are within touching distance of the Euro 2020 knockout stage as they visit Rome for their final group game against an Italy side in ominous form.

title: Scotland fans clean up London after Euro celebrations
description: Fans took part in a clean-up of Leicester Square which was covered in litter during celebrations.

title: Iran election: Hardliner Raisi will become president
description: Cleric Ebrahim Raisi, Iran's top judge, wins victory in election seen as engineered to help him win.

title: Paul Givan told he must resign as NI first minister
description: Days after he got the role, the Democratic Unionist Party MLA is told he will have to resign when a new leader takes over.

title: Man looking for Mayfair 'guardian angel' who saved his life
description: A woman helped Mathew O'Toole while he was suffering from a stroke in Wigmore Street, Mayfair.

title: Juneteenth: After decades, Opal Lee finally gets her day off
description: Opal Lee campaigned for years for a national holiday to commemorate the end of slavery in the US.

title: England fast bowler Stone out for season with back injury
description: England fast bowler Olly Stone is ruled out of the remainder of the summer with a stress fracture of the back.

title: Fears Liverpool may lose World Heritage status
description: Figures from politics and football urge Unesco not to strip the city of the prestigious status.

title: Daniel Morgan case: I don't accept Met's apology - son says
description: He tells of his anger after a report calls the force "institutionally corrupt" in its handling of Morgan's murder.

title: In pictures: Scotland fans celebrate England result
description: Thousands were in London for the Euro 2020 match against England, while others watched from the Glasgow fan zone.

title: Chesham and Amersham by-election defeat a warning shot, says Tory co-chairman
description: Planning reforms for England and HS2 rail had dominated campaigning in Chesham and Amersham.

title: Mosh pits and no masks at Download Festival pilot
description: This weekend's Download Festival is part of a live event trial to see if large-scale gatherings are possible.

title: Download Pilot Festival: Rock and metal event returns post-Covid
description: Rock and metal fans are dusting off their devil horns for the first Download Festival in two years.

title: Ipswich: 'It's surprising we have the lowest Covid rate'
description: Why does Ipswich have the lowest coronavirus figures in England?

title: Unknown pleasures: Charting the rise of Factory Records
description: A show charting Factory Records - from punk start-up to "influential force" - opens in Manchester.

title: 'I trained for a 1,000-mile cycle on chemotherapy'
description: Terminally ill Gaz Emmerson is cycling the length of Great Britain to raise money for others with sarcoma.

title: Myanmar coup: UN calls for arms embargo against military
description: In a rare move, the UN condemns the overthrowing of Aung San Suu Kyi and calls for an arms embargo.
